#summary Declaration of enums.
<wiki:toc max_depth="3"/>

= Enum declaration =
The syntax to declare an enum is specified by:
<blockquote><em>
enum-declaration:
    annotations<sub>opt</sub> enum-modifiers<sub>opt</sub> <tt>enum</tt> identifier type-base<sub>opt</sub> enum-body ;<sub>opt</sub>
</em></blockquote>
An enum is a special kind of class.

= Enum modifiers =
The enum modifiers in Stab have the same usage and semantic as the enum modifiers in Java.
<blockquote><em>
enum-modifiers:
    enum-modifier<br/>
    enum-modifiers enum-modifier
enum-modifier:
    <b>One of</b> <tt>public protected private</tt>
</em></blockquote>

= Enum body =
The enum body is the place where the members of an enum are declared.
<blockquote><em>
enum-body:
    { enum-constant-declarations<sub>opt</sub> ;<sub>opt</sub> class-member-declarations<sub>opt</sub> }
enum-constant-declarations:
    enum-constant-declaration<br/>
    enum-constant-declarations , enum-constant-declaration
enum-constant-declaration:
    annotations<sub>opt</sub> identifier argument-list<sub>opt</sub> class-body<sub>opt</sub>
</em></blockquote>
